Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2014 10:22AM MLP wrote: Good day Ladies,  My surgery was 2 years ago. In 2012 I had a bilateral mastectomy and reconstruction. I had 5 lymph nodes removed. I needed no further treatment.I've gone back to my normal activities. I really haven't thought about lymphodema until now. I've done several 5Ks last year and have been asked to do a mud run. Do I run the risk of LE crawling through mud or am I looking for an excuse to stay out of the muck?
Posts.Title: Kicking LE's butt!! Exercise & Self Care Log Tina337 Flynn

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2014 03:21PM MLP wrote: Carol, I guess ignorance is bliss, at least in my case. I did my first 5K in 90 degree weather. I figured my heart must be in better shape than I thought because I lived through it.  Thanks for the link, it was very informative. I had no idea of the risks.  I just dove back into my life without thinking about it. I've been very lucky.   Here's the link to the fun.  http://lozilu.com/
Posts.Title: Kicking LE's butt!! Exercise & Self Care Log Tina337 Flynn

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2012 06:29PM MLP wrote: Sonant, Maybe a bit of humor will help. I am over 50 and overweight. I really fought to save the breast I didn't need to remove. The doctor showed me a picture of myself and when I saw how much I sagged it really helped me make the decision to remove both and start life anew with a perky new pair of breasts. I've also lost 10 lbs.since my BMX 3 weeks ago. Who knew! I've avoided mirrors for ages. Now I'm looking forward to a healthier fitter future!
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant
